greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of ways a loop can cross three roads meeting in a Y n times. The loop must touch the southwest sector.
comment: The Mercedes-Benz problem: closed meanders crossing a Y.
example: With three crossings the loop must cut each road exactly once, so a(3) = 1.
With 4 crossings the loop can cut one road 4 times (giving A005315(2)*2 = 4 possibilities), or two roads twice each (3 ways), so a(4) = 7.
xref: See A085919 for another version. Cf. A078105 (nonisomorphic solutions), A077460 and A005315 (loop crossing one road).
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_ and _Jon Wild_, Dec 05 2002
